com.example.sip
Class MapBoroughResultActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
                      com.example.sip.MapBoroughResultActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public class MapBoroughResultActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

This activity is used by two other activities to show Borough results on the map. These two activities are the following: UnemploymentActivity, ScholarBoroughActivity. Boroughs are added on the map in the form of markers and also their boundaries are drawn by the use of polygons.

Author:
Loucas Stylianou

Constructor Detail

MapBoroughResultActivity

public MapBoroughResultActivity()
Method Detail

addMarker

public void addMarker(int index,
                      float color,
                      java.lang.String snippet)
This method takes as parameters the index which is the location of the borough in the boroughArray, the colour that the marker should have and the snippet which is the text below the title shown on the info box of the marker.

Parameters:
index - Location of the borough in the boroughArray
color - Color of the marker
snippet - Text below the title of the marker on the info box

addPolygon

public void addPolygon(int index,
                       int color)
This method takes two parameters index and colour. Index is used to get the borough's boundaries and the colour is used to set the fill colour of the polygon according to the given one.

Parameters:
index - Location of the borough object on the boroughArray
color - The colour that should be used to paint the polygon.

connectWidgets

private void connectWidgets()
This method established connection between this class (activity) fields and the android widgets found in map_result_activity.xml file

onCreate

protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
When this activity is created all data passed through the intent by the previous activity are stored to the corresponding fields. Also the connection between this class fields and the android widgets found in the map_result_activity.xml file is established. The camera of google map object focus on London territory and zooms as much as is needed. Markers and polygons are added on the map and colored according to the information that has been retrieved from

Overrides:
onCreate in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

onResume

public void onResume()
This method defines the actions that should be done under user interaction with the program during the execution stage. When the user clicks on the info window of a marker then this activity terminates and steps to the next activity which is the BoroughProfileActivity. Also if the user press on one of the green, yellow and red buttons the corresponding message box appears to introduce to the user the use of colour for markers and polygons. This is done by the use of the toast. Finally when the user clicks on the button for markers then it shows/hides the markers on the map according the state that is taken by the boolean variable markersVisibility.

Overrides:
onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
